officialTitle: Recovery of Muscle Function After Deep Neuromuscular Block by Means of Dia-phragm Ultrasonography and Adductor Pollicis Acceleromyography: Comparison of Neostigmine vs. Sugammadex as Reversal Drugs.
inclusionCriteria:
* ASA physical status I-II
* age between 18-80 years old
* dNMB with rocuronium during ear nose and throat (ENT) surgery
* Must have minimum age of 18 Years
* Must have maximum age of 80 Years
exclusionCriteria:
* Clinical diagnosis of hepatic or renal disease
* Clinical diagnosis of chronic or acute alcoholism
* History of allergy or hypersensitivity to Sugammadex and/or atropine or Neostigmine
* Current medications with CNS effects
* History of neurologic disease
* Diaphragmatic palsy
* Pregnancy or nursing
* History of malignant arrhythmias
